{{Marvel Database:Team Template | Image = Seraphim (Akah Ma'at) (Earth-616) from Doctor Strange, Sorcerer Supreme Vol 1 49 001.jpg | ImageSize = 250px | Name = Seraphim | EditorialNames = | Aliases = Serraphim{{r|Doctor Strange Vol 2 13}} | Status = Active | Identity = Secret | Reality = Earth-616 | BaseOfOperations = [[Citadels of Sephiroth]], [[Planes of Sephiroth]], [[Archipelago of Anguish and Redemption]]; formerly [[Akah Ma'at]], [[Earth]] | Leaders = [[Shamhat Saraswati (Earth-616)|Shamhat Saraswati]] | CurrentMembers = [[Shamhat Saraswati (Earth-616)|Shamhat Saraswati]] | FormerMembers = | Allies = [[Yao (Earth-616)|Ancient One]], [[Stephen Strange (Earth-616)|Doctor Strange]], [[Asura (Akah Ma'at) (Earth-616)|Asura]] | Enemies = Formerly [[Asura (Akah Ma'at) (Earth-616)|Asura]] | Origin = Faction of the [[Bird-Men of Akah Ma'at]] | PlaceOfFormation = | PlaceOfDissolution = | Creators = Len Kaminski; Geof Isherwood | First = Strange Tales #1 | First2 = (Mentioned){{Verify source}}
{{sld|Doctor Strange, Sorcerer Supreme #49}} | HistoryText = ===Origin and early years=== The '''Seraphim''' were descended from the [[Bird-Men of Akah Ma'at]], a race created by the [[Elder Gods of Earth|Elder Goddess]] [[Oshtur (Earth-616)|Oshtur]]{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 7|; Magic - Index: A: Commonly Invoked Mystic Principalities}} as a counterpoint to [[Set (Earth-616)|Set]]'s and [[Chthon (Earth-616)|Chthon]]'s [[Elderspawn|beast races]].{{r|Marvel Zombies: The Book of Angels, Demons & Various Monstrosities #1|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' entry}} [[Agamotto (Earth-616)|Agamotto]] chose a new Sorceress Supreme from among their ranks, [[Shamhat Saraswati (Earth-616)|Shamhat Saraswati]]. Guided by Shamhat and her sponsors Oshtur and Agamotto, the Bird-Men of Akah Ma'at soon evolved into powerful sorcerers and almost godlike beings, the '''Winged Lords''', with [[Varuna (Earth-616)|Varuna]] becoming the most powerful among them.{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 3|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' profile }} Chthon's lies caused Varuna, the most powerful of the Winged Lords of Akah Ma'at, to become suspicious of the "lower races",{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 1|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' profile }} and some of Akah Ma'at eventually grew indifferent to the well-being of "lesser" beings. The most evolved of the Bird Men split into two factions:{{r|Marvel Zombies: The Book of Angels, Demons & Various Monstrosities #1|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' profile}} * Varuna gathered same-minded followers,{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 1|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' profile }} the "righteous avengers" of the [[Asura (Akah Ma'at) (Earth-616)|'''Asura''']],{{r|[http://www.marvunapp.com/ohotmu/appendixes/mdapp.htm Mystic Dimensions - From the Journals of Ian McNee at the Appendix]: The [[Archipelago of Anguish and Redemption|Splinter Realms (The Dark Dimension, the Archipelago of Anguish and Redemption)]], The [[Citadels of Sephiroth]]'s entry}} who felt superior and wished to force their will on others,{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 1|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' profile }} Varuna became Judge and Executioner, and allegedly used the stars to spy upon Man.{{r|Marvel Tarot #1|; Wolf Book}} * Ashamed at their fellows, Saraswati and her followers,{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 1|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' profile }} the "peaceful guardians"{{r|[http://www.marvunapp.com/ohotmu/appendixes/mdapp.htm Mystic Dimensions - From the Journals of Ian McNee at the Appendix]: The [[Archipelago of Anguish and Redemption|Splinter Realms (The Dark Dimension, the Archipelago of Anguish and Redemption)]], The [[Citadels of Sephiroth]]'s entry}} of the '''Seraphim''', vowed to protect those the Asura would harm,{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 1|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' profile }} thus remaining true to their purpose of protecting mankind.{{r|Marvel Zombies: The Book of Angels, Demons & Various Monstrosities #1|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' profile}} ===War and banishment=== The ideological dispute grew into a civil war, with the help of Chthon,{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 7|; Magic - History of the [[Sorcerer Supreme]]}} who took advantage of this schism, and turned the factions against one another.{{r|[http://www.marvunapp.com/ohotmu/appendixes/mdapp.htm Mystic Dimensions - From the Journals of Ian McNee at the Appendix]: The [[Archipelago of Anguish and Redemption|Splinter Realms (The Dark Dimension, the Archipelago of Anguish and Redemption)]], The [[Citadels of Sephiroth]]'s entry}} Ultimately, the Seraphim and Asura grew so destructive,{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 7|; Magic - History of the [[Sorcerer Supreme]]}} and the conflict caused massive earthly devastation, that Oshtur was forced to intervene. Oshtur banished both the Asura and Seraphim,{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 3|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' profile }} and the whole city, into the [[Dark Dimension]] (The [[Archipelago of Anguish and Redemption|Splinter Realms, or the "Archipelago of Anguish and Redemption")]],{{r|[http://www.marvunapp.com/ohotmu/appendixes/mdapp.htm Mystic Dimensions - From the Journals of Ian McNee at the Appendix]: The [[Archipelago of Anguish and Redemption|Splinter Realms (The Dark Dimension, the Archipelago of Anguish and Redemption)]], The [[Citadels of Sephiroth]]'s entry}} to the extradimensional [[Planes of Sephiroth]].{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 3|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' profile }} By 11,000 BC, the Bird Folk had "ascended".{{r|Marvel Tarot #1|; Timeline of the [[Sorcerer Supreme]]}} One account mention the Winged Lords "prepared to journey [...] into the [[Higher Realms]]",{{r|Marvel Tarot #1|; Wolf Book}} though the exact circumstances of the banishment are unknown. ===On Sephiroth=== Stranded in a hostile environment, the Seraphim and Asura secured an uneasy yet lasting peace. Together, they forged the [[Citadels of Sephiroth]], who served as a line of defense against creature from the Dark Dimension that would invade the [[Lower Realms]].{{r|[http://www.marvunapp.com/ohotmu/appendixes/mdapp.htm Mystic Dimensions - From the Journals of Ian McNee at the Appendix]: The [[Archipelago of Anguish and Redemption|Splinter Realms (The Dark Dimension, the Archipelago of Anguish and Redemption)]], The [[Citadels of Sephiroth]]'s entry}} The Bird Men continued to evolve there{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 1|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' entry}} and still reside there.{{r|Marvel Tarot #1|; Wolf Book}} The Seraphim became at some point (possibly before their banishment) [[mystic principalities]], whose names were often invoked for spells such as the [[Shield of the Seraphim|Shield]], the [[Skill of the Seraphim|Skill]], the [[Speed of the Seraphim|Speed]], the [[Circle of the Seraphim|Circle]], and the [[Serum of the Seraphim]]. They became known across the dimensions for their spells of protection and defense.{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 7|; Magic - Index: A: Commonly Invoked Mystic Principalities}} They also became enemies of [[Shaeol]], and would later be involved in the extradimensional [[War of the Seven Spheres]], themselves opposing Shaeol.{{r|Doctor Strange, Sorcerer Supreme #49}} The [[S'raphh]], a pure-hearted race that resided on Earth's [[Luna (Moon)|Moon]] millenia ago, may have been descendants of the Bird-Men of Akah Ma'at, perhaps remnants of the Seraphim faction who might have evaded the banishment of their people.{{r|Fear Itself: Fellowship of Fear #1|; [[Null the Living Darkness (Earth-616)|Null]]'s entry}} ===[[Modern Age]]=== ====War of the Seven Spheres==== Before the [[War of the Seven Spheres]] began, many of the [[Principalities]] and mystic entities usually invoked for power sought to recruit [[Stephen Strange (Earth-616)|Doctor Strange]] to fight for them. Escaping them by using spells from other entities, Strange eventually ended up among the Seraphim after having used the [[Shield of the Seraphim]] to escape [[Cyttorak (Earth-616)|Cyttorak]]. The Seraphim asked for Strange's help to march against their enemy, [[Shaeol]]. Soon, Cyttorak, [[Ikonn (Earth-616)|Ikonn]], the [[Vishanti (Earth-616)|Vishanti]] ([[Agamotto (Earth-616)|Agamotto]], [[Oshtur (Earth-616)|Oshtur]], and [[Hoggoth (Earth-616)|Hoggoth]]), the [[Faltine]], [[Raggadorr (Earth-616)|Raggadorr]], [[Munnopor (Earth-616)|Munipoor]], [[Satannish (Earth-616)|Satannish]], [[Valtorr (Earth-616)|Valtorr]], and [[Denak (Earth-616)|Denak]] arrived to claim Strange for their side. To escape them all, Strange invoked the [[Law of Emancipation]], relinquish the ability to call upon any of the powers and principalities.{{r|Doctor Strange, Sorcerer Supreme #49}} The conflict would last five thousand years, though waged within months by human reckoning.{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 8|; [[Octessence (Earth-616)|Octessence]]'s profile}} | Equipment = | Transportation = | Weapons = | Notes = | Trivia = | Links = }} [[Category:Bird-Men of Akah Ma'at]] [[Category:Mystic Principalities]]
